intro: Benthamidia capitata var. khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi benthamidia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
